result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachery E Eggert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Collections may include income assignment.

No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia//drugs without a valid prescription and must be verified to Agent.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  6 months Huber - Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachery E Eggert

defendant.name: Eggert, Zachery E
defendant.address: 515 West Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Zachery E Eggert in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following:
- Total sentence: 3 years 6 months (Initial Confinement 1 year 6 months, Extended Supervision: 2 years) STAYED.  Credit for 55 days if revoked.
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 3 years Probation. 
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  No contact with Amber C., Ashley C., or Amenada H.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription and must be verified to Agent.  Follow through with AODA treatment/counseling.  
CONDITION TIME: 6 months - NON WORKING HOURS WITH RELEASE FOR WORK AND TREATMENT ONLY - To commence FORTHWITH.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Zachery E Eggert in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Weathers requests bail be modified.  State objects.  Court denies the request.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 5, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Zachery E Eggert
Current: 515 West Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 02-25-2015)
Prior: 5074 North 51st Blvd, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witnesses/business listed in the complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.

Defendant Zachery E Eggert in court, in custody, with attorney Tony Rosario for  M. Elizabeth Weathers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
